Operation 'CreateSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint but lacks context about what the operation actually does, what inputs are required, what is returned, and the segment population timeline. Added clarity about segment creation, input requirements, response structure, and side effects (segment population timing) for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Segment `name` has to be unique. A user can not create a new segment with an existing segment name.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new marketing segment with the provided name and criteria. The segment name must be unique; attempting to create a segment with an existing name will fail. Returns the created segment object with its ID and initial configuration. The segment will begin populating with contacts matching the defined criteria within 15 minutes for existing contacts, or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria.
data.reasoning: Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint but lacks context about what the operation actually does, what inputs are required, what is returned, and the segment population timeline. Added clarity about segment creation, input requirements, response structure, and side effects (segment population timing) for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary is generic. Description has filtering logic but lacks clarity about pagination, response structure, and the refresh timing context. Improved summary to be more specific and reorganized description to clearly explain filtering options, response behavior, and segment refresh timing for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of segments.**

The query param `parent_list_ids` is treated as a filter.  Any match will be returned.  Zero matches will return a response code of 200 with an empty `results` array.

`parent_list_ids` | `no_parent_list_id` | `ids` | `result`
-----------------:|:--------------------:|:-------------:|:-------------:
empty | false | empty | all segments values
list_ids | false | empty | segments filtered by list_ids values
list_ids |true | empty | segments filtered by list_ids and segments with no parent list_ids empty
empty | true | empty | segments with no parent list_ids
anything | anything | ids | segments with matching segment ids |
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a list of marketing segments
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all marketing segments with optional filtering. Supports filtering by parent list IDs and/or specific segment IDs. The `parent_list_ids` parameter filters segments by their associated contact lists, the `no_parent_list_id` parameter includes segments with no parent list, and the `ids` parameter retrieves specific segments by ID. Returns a 200 response with a `results` array containing matching segments; an empty array is returned if no segments match the filter criteria. Segment samples and counts are refreshed approximately once per hour.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. Description has filtering logic but lacks clarity about pagination, response structure, and the refresh timing context. Improved summary to be more specific and reorganized description to clearly explain filtering options, response behavior, and segment refresh timing for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'UpdateSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint and doesn't explain what the operation does, what can be updated, or the effects of updates. Added clarity about partial update support, input requirements, response structure, and side effects (segment refresh timing) for improved AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Segment `name` has to be unique. A user can not create a new segment with an existing segment name.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing marketing segment identified by segment ID. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. The segment name must be unique; attempting to update to an existing segment name will fail. Returns the updated segment object. Changes to segment criteria will trigger a refresh of the segment's contact list, with newly matching contacts included within 15 minutes for existing contacts or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria.
data.reasoning: Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint and doesn't explain what the operation does, what can be updated, or the effects of updates. Added clarity about partial update support, input requirements, response structure, and side effects (segment refresh timing) for improved AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Original summary lacks capitalization consistency and description is too minimal. Added context about what deletion means operationally (segment unavailability, data implications), that it's irreversible, and the expected response code. This helps AI agents understand the consequences of using this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a segment by ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a marketing segment identified by segment ID. Once deleted, the segment will no longer be available for use in automations or single sends, and its associated contact data will no longer be maintained. This action cannot be undone. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks capitalization consistency and description is too minimal. Added context about what deletion means operationally (segment unavailability, data implications), that it's irreversible, and the expected response code. This helps AI agents understand the consequences of using this operation.

message: Operation 'RefreshSegment' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about asynchronous processing, the response code, refresh timing, and the relationship to automatic hourly refreshes. Added these details to help AI agents understand what happens after calling this operation and when results will be available.

data.current_description: Manually refresh a segment by segment ID.
data.description_suggestion: Manually triggers a refresh of a marketing segment identified by segment ID, updating its contact list to include any newly matching contacts based on current criteria. Returns a 202 Accepted response indicating the refresh operation has been queued. The segment refresh will complete asynchronously; contacts matching the segment criteria will be updated within 15 minutes for existing contacts or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria. Note that segments are automatically refreshed hourly.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about asynchronous processing, the response code, refresh timing, and the relationship to automatic hourly refreshes. Added these details to help AI agents understand what happens after calling this operation and when results will be available.

The query param `parent_list_ids` is treated as a filter.  Any match will be returned.  Zero matches will return a response code of 200 with an empty `results` array.

`parent_list_ids` | `no_parent_list_id` | `ids` | `result`
-----------------:|:--------------------:|:-------------:|:-------------:
empty | false | empty | all segments values
list_ids | false | empty | segments filtered by list_ids values
list_ids |true | empty | segments filtered by list_ids and segments with no parent list_ids empty
empty | true | empty | segments with no parent list_ids
anything | anything | ids | segments with matching segment ids |
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a list of marketing segments
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all marketing segments with optional filtering. Supports filtering by parent list IDs and/or specific segment IDs. The `parent_list_ids` parameter filters segments by their associated contact lists, the `no_parent_list_id` parameter includes segments with no parent list, and the `ids` parameter retrieves specific segments by ID. Returns a 200 response with a `results` array containing matching segments; an empty array is returned if no segments match the filter criteria. Segment samples and counts are refreshed approximately once per hour.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. Description has filtering logic but lacks clarity about pagination, response structure, and the refresh timing context. Improved summary to be more specific and reorganized description to clearly explain filtering options, response behavior, and segment refresh timing for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'UpdateSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint and doesn't explain what the operation does, what can be updated, or the effects of updates. Added clarity about partial update support, input requirements, response structure, and side effects (segment refresh timing) for improved AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Segment `name` has to be unique. A user can not create a new segment with an existing segment name.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing marketing segment identified by segment ID. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. The segment name must be unique; attempting to update to an existing segment name will fail. Returns the updated segment object. Changes to segment criteria will trigger a refresh of the segment's contact list, with newly matching contacts included within 15 minutes for existing contacts or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria.
data.reasoning: Original description only mentions the uniqueness constraint and doesn't explain what the operation does, what can be updated, or the effects of updates. Added clarity about partial update support, input requirements, response structure, and side effects (segment refresh timing) for improved AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Original summary lacks capitalization consistency and description is too minimal. Added context about what deletion means operationally (segment unavailability, data implications), that it's irreversible, and the expected response code. This helps AI agents understand the consequences of using this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a segment by ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a marketing segment identified by segment ID. Once deleted, the segment will no longer be available for use in automations or single sends, and its associated contact data will no longer be maintained. This action cannot be undone. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks capitalization consistency and description is too minimal. Added context about what deletion means operationally (segment unavailability, data implications), that it's irreversible, and the expected response code. This helps AI agents understand the consequences of using this operation.

message: Operation 'RefreshSegment' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about asynchronous processing, the response code, refresh timing, and the relationship to automatic hourly refreshes. Added these details to help AI agents understand what happens after calling this operation and when results will be available.

data.current_description: Manually refresh a segment by segment ID.
data.description_suggestion: Manually triggers a refresh of a marketing segment identified by segment ID, updating its contact list to include any newly matching contacts based on current criteria. Returns a 202 Accepted response indicating the refresh operation has been queued. The segment refresh will complete asynchronously; contacts matching the segment criteria will be updated within 15 minutes for existing contacts or approximately 30 minutes for engagement-based criteria. Note that segments are automatically refreshed hourly.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about asynchronous processing, the response code, refresh timing, and the relationship to automatic hourly refreshes. Added these details to help AI agents understand what happens after calling this operation and when results will be available.

message: Semantic analysis completed: 6 operations analyzed, 5 quality issues found
